title: Enormous FPS Drop in new game mode (Nexus Siege)
body:
I don't know if its only me, but i experience huge fps drops when playing this mode. I really enjoyed it, but having 100 fps drop all the way to 30 fps is no enjoyable. Please someone fix this. I think is when my screen tries to load the new graphics (turrets) or something like that.

I play on a Macbook Pro Late 2012, Mac osx El Capitan
8GB RAM, INTEL HD GRAPHICS 4000.
(For everyone that comments about playing on a mac or intel graphics, i get 100 fps on normals, so it isn't normal to have this kind of fps drop.)

replies.body: Already saw that post and repaired files, no solution... Still fps drop.

I have had similar problems with my Mid 2012 13" MBP/Boot Camp Win10 for the last 3 patches. Weird thing is that ARAM and some featured game modes (DND and whatever was on Howling Abyss that patch - Poro king perhaps?) shows massive performance loss. SR is fine, though.

I usually play the game on Mid graphics with no problems, for these modes I have to set it to lowest and I still experience frame drops. The FPS counter stays high (typically 60-100) but I have noticeable rubberbanding slowing down/speeding up.

edit: Intel HD 4000

I messed with all of the settings and put them down to the lowest as well, and I had someone else in the game mode (also on a Mac) complaining last night too.  

This really seems like a client bug, or at least a widespread conflict.  Please pass this on to your Mac dev team, and maybe they can help narrow this down.  

I have not played any Normals since the patch, but is anyone having problems there or is it just the new mode?
Same issue here. Lowering the graphics made no difference. Usually I can have 130-160 fps. This issue happens only in Nexus Siege.

Yep, it's Mac issue for sure.  I am on a Mid 2012 Macbook Pro also running El Capitan and there is horrific studded.  

Everyone should list their graphics cards, as that is usually the common theme with these problems.  I have a NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M 1024 MB, but I am not using the built in OSX Driver.  Nvidia has their own "web drives" you can download, and I have been using that.
I have the same problem, its fun but not enjoyable with the FPS dropping.
I have the same problem. there is constant FPS drop, it's unplayable.

FPS issues can sometimes be due to settings or outdated software on your computer.  It may also have trouble rendering game assets if those files are corrupt.  We have an [FPS Troubleshoot ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#section-mac)guide available to help tune-up your system as well provide repair instructions if necessary.  Please make sure to select the red Mac box for your specific issue!  I hope that it will help fix this up for you and get you back in the game!
